abstract: The online marketing firm 24/7 Media on Wednesday disclosed that it has hired Lehman Brothers to help it assess “strategic alternatives,” adding credence to rampant speculation that the company is up for sale. The New York Post reported this week that both WPP Group, the London-based advertising and marketing group, and software gaint Microsoft were “leading contenders” to buy 24/7, which has a market capitalization of about $560 million.
